OK, problem is that I was missing the two plug-ins in my workspace. But a more 
helpful error message than a stack trace would be nice. Why are these plug-ins 
not required by anybody and I need them anyway.

With the new runtime everybody needs application.runner and update.configurator.
The first one starts the application, the second allows to untight the 
update/install mechanism from the boot sequence.

We will work on the user experience to avoid not so good messages

The main issue here is that the runtime is actually a collection of plugins 
which are releated to one another and currently need to be physically co-
located.  If you put one in the workspace, they all need to be there.

This is documented in the porting guide but not called out as explicitly as it 
could be.  Note also that we are working to elimate/combine as many of these as 
possible.

This problem has been fixed in M6 and is similar to bug #48071.
Closing.
